newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Rashid gets 2.2 bln rgt loan for bank stake.
newsitem.headline: Rashid gets 2.2 bln rgt loan for bank stake.

text.p: Malaysian stockbroking group Rashid Hussain Bhd said on Friday it has obtained a 2.2 billion ringgit credit facility to bridge finance the acquisition of a 75 percent stake in Kwong Yik Bank Bhd.
The loan will be provided by offshore banks in Malaysia's Labuan island, a financial centre off Borneo.

The banks are Bayerische Landesbank Girozentrale, Development Bank of Singapore, Sakura Bank, ABN-AMRO Bank, Bank of Commerce, Deutsche Bank, EON Bank, Bank of Nova Scotia, Pacific Bank, Southern Bank, Standard Chartered Bank and Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi, Rashid said in a statement.
Last November, Rashid entered into an agreement with Malayan Banking Bhd to acquire 245.5 million shares in Kwong Yik Bank for 2.16 billion ringgit in cash.

Rashid is injecting the Kwong Yik Bank stake into its 20 percent-owned associate DCB Holdings Bhd as part of a restructuring which will result in Rashid ending up with a 55 percent stake in DCB Holdings.
Rashid said it would seek shareholders approval for the proposed restructuring at an extraordinary general meeting on March 6.
"The proposed acquisition of Kwong Yik Bank is expected to be completed two weeks after that," it said.
